alert.note: Alert for Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:22AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern San Juan County through NOON MDT... At 1122 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Tselakai Dezza, or 21 miles east of Mexican Hat, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montezuma Creek and Bluff. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 5 and 15, and between mile markers 24 and 35. Utah 162 between mile markers 0 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
